channel.title: Les paul drawing
channel.description:
Well, I'm thinking of building my own Les Paul from scratch, but I need an accurate drawing. I've been looking for one but I cant find it. It can be a scaled one or a 1:1 drawing, I dont care. But it has to be a good one. So if someone knows where to find one (not google, I tried that), preferably free, please tell ;)
Thanks in advance.

item.title: Les paul drawing
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Well it kinda depends.
One of the main things about the body is that it’s countermeasured by the headstock in an electric guitar. They’re both supposed to even out a little on the weight so when you play, it’s not falling in either direction too much.

Read full topic

item.title: Les paul drawing
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Well, since you have more experience in making a guitar then I do, does the size of the body matter? If it’s a bit bigger or a bit smaller then a standard les paul it doesnt matter right?

Read full topic

item.title: Les paul drawing
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Look up Les Paul specifications and compare them?

I don’t think the problem is that you don’t have anyone to work the wood for you or help you do that.
You would need the knowledge of a luthier to make it work.

If you really want to go through with it though, I suggest buying a premade neck and just building the body itself, then adding and soldering the electronics too. That way you at least get a workable guitar. And if you do that, why not make some modifications to the Les Paul body? That way it’s even more of your own.

Read full topic

item.title: Les paul drawing
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I have a drawing of the shape, that’s not the problem. I need the sizes. How can I make something without knowing the sizes? It’s my first one yes, but it doesnt have to be perfect. You can learn from your mistakes. Also I get help from my father, who’s a carpenter and has quite a bit of experience. If we both can’t do something, I can get help from my uncle who is even better with wood.

Read full topic

item.title: Les paul drawing
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

You’re in for WAY more than you think if you’re going to build a guitar from scratch.
I did that for my senior project last year.

If you’re already asking for help because you can’t find a drawing, you’re not going to make it.

Making a guitar by yourself takes EXTREME precision and if it’s your first one it’s probably going to take you at least 7 months to get a working one.

Getting any of the fret markers off by as small as a millimeter will screw up the entire thing really.

Read full topic

item.title: Les paul drawing
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Sorry i don’t got what your looking for, but I’ve always wondered if home made guitars can be any good?
If you say, make the body, neck, head, then buy the electric and metal parts.

Read full topic
